intro: Lefebvrea microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited lefebvria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
